intro: Saussurea pseudotilesii, commonly known as the Tibetan safflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Tibet. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy, yellowish to orange-colored flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Saussurea pseudotilesii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Tibetan medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
